dialogue: [It’s alright. His father helps with so much of it. Very manageable.]
[Oh. I see.]
[And your oldest! She’s attending UCLA in the Fall, right?]
[Oh...still good!]
[Yeah! Yeah.]
[You must be so proud to be her mom.]
[Of course! We raise them from children to now. How could we not be?]
[What about Chris?] Chris! Wow, so handsome. [Just like Ma Ying-jeou.]
[Chris, he...he uh-] [He’s exploring new interests.]
[Oh! Like what?]
[Didi, do you want to tell Shiu-Fang Ah-Yi your interests?]
[Like...umm he really likes skateboarding. And cameras. Video movie stuff.]
[Oh! Movie director! Ang Lee!]
[Yes! Exactly. My little Ang Lee. Maybe one day he will thank me in his Oscar speech.]
[Chris, Good luck. Finding success as an artist is a tough journey.] [Just ask your mother.]
Chris, good luck.
[You should watch some of his videos. They’re really fun.]
[Mhmmm...has Chris started PSAT prep?]
[Not yet. It’s early, no?]
[Early!? Max started his eighth grade summer and he got 2250 on his SAT - first try. It’s so competitive nowadays. Chris should’ve started last year.]
[Wow. I didn’t know.]
[You should take him to Max’s tutor! I’ll give you his number.]
[Would you? I’d appreciate that.]
